d.q: A technician needs to run a diagnostic DVD on a laptop running Windows 8.1. After setting the boot order in the UEFI BIOS to the internal DVD-RW drive, the laptop still boots into Windows. Which of the following settings needs to be adjusted in order for the laptop to boot from the DVD-RW drive?

A technician connects a second monitor to a desktop. It is physically located to the right of the existing monitor, but the mouse pointer can only get to the second monitor by moving to the left edge of the screen of the first monitor. Which of following display settings needs to be adjusted to get the pointer to move with the physical placement of the monitor?
Which of the following types of cables are MOST likely to be used to connect to an external hard drive? (Select TWO).
A customer is building a high-end gaming PC and is seeking an appropriate power supply unit. Which of the following feature-sets of a power supply should be installed? (Select THREE).
Which of the following is required during the installation of a digitizer?

choices.A: Must be connected to the Internet

choices.C: Must have the latest software installed

d.q: A technician is troubleshooting an expansion card in a computer that allows the computer to receive faxes over a VoIP line. The line connected to the expansion card is MOST likely which of the following cable types?
For which of the following types of printers should a technician obtain a maintenance kit containing a fuser, transfer roller, and pickup rollers?
Which of the following cable connection types is an example of a mini DIN?
A customer wants a computer for performing a single-threaded task as quickly as possible. Which of the following CPU characteristics is the MOST important?
0 Which of the following display technologies provides the BEST range of visible colors?
1 A customer wants to transfer data from the DVR to a DVD. Which of the following should be used on a workstation in order to extract the data for archiving?
2 A small workgroup inherits a second-hand printer without networking capabilities. Which of the following is the BEST method of sharing this resource among the workgroup?

choices.A: Connect the printer to a Bluetooth adapter in order for the users to print

choices.B: Connect the printer by using the onboard Infrared port

choices.C: Connect the printer to a user’s workstation and share the device

choices.D: Connect the printer to a parallel switch box

d.q: 3 A customer needs a router that will be able to handle all incoming and outgoing networking traffic independent of the rest of the building. The customer would like the PCs to immediately connect to the Internet and network resources without any additional configuration. Which of the following should the technician do to meet the requirements?

choices.C: Configure the router for port forwarding.

5 Which of the following expansion ports would be used to enable transfer of power, data, and video to peripheral devices on an Apple computer?
6 Which of the following are the BEST features to include in a Home Theater PC? (Select TWO).

7 A user reports the inability to access a company server using the FTP protocol. A technician finds other ports to the server seem to work normally. The technician has determined the problem is an incorrectly configured software firewall on the user’s machine. Which of the following is MOST likely the cause?

choices.A: Incoming connections on port 445 are blocked.

choices.B: Outgoing connections on port 443 are blocked.

choices.C: Incoming connections on port 143 are blocked.

choices.D: Outgoing connections on port 80 are blocked.

choices.E: Outgoing connections on port 21 are blocked.

d.q: 8 A user is reporting that a desktop computer with a RAID 1 array is running slowly. Upon performing a reboot, the technician sees S.M.A.R.T. errors during boot up. Which of the following tools would the technician use FIRST to troubleshoot the errors?

9 A technician is setting up a printer in a training room. The trainer needs to be able to print multiple copies of the training documentation for the classes. Which of the following should the technician configure on the printer to facilitate this?
0 A technician has been tasked with setting up email on a user’s phone. The user also wants the email to remain on the server. Which of the following ports would be BEST for setting up the phone?
3 There are 20 laptops in a room and they all need to connect wirelessly to the network. Which of the following would be the BEST device to use?
4 A user’s iPhone will not power on. Which of the following should the technician do FIRST to isolate the problem?

choices.A: Plug the phone into a known good charger

choices.D: Replace the battery and charge the phone.

d.q: 5 Which of the following protocols would be used for file sharing between MAC OS and Windows OS workstations on a LAN?

7 A technician is troubleshooting an expansion card in a computer that allows the computer to receive faxes over a VoIP line. The telephone line connected to the expansion card is MOST likely which of the following cable types?

8 A technician works for a company that has virtual servers and virtual desktops. The company hires a user who only needs to access the virtual desktops. Which of the following is the MOST cost-effective workstation to purchase?
9 Which of the following components of a motherboard is responsible for communications between CPU and RAM?

0 A computer technician wants to boot up a computer using a USB flash drive. After inserting the USB drive and powering on the computer, it does not boot to the flash drive and instead boots to the OS on the hard drive. Which of the following is MOST likely the cause?

choices.A: The boot order in the BIOS is incorrect

choices.B: The hard drive is not formatted

choices.C: There is a disc in the optical drive

d.q: 1 A user, Joe, is watching a training education video and notices dark pin-sized dots in the same location on his laptop LCD screen. Which of the following is the cause of this issue?
2 A user wants to connect a laptop to the office LAN, charge the battery, and have a dual screen setup. Which of the following would BEST solve this user's requirements?
3 A customer asks a technician to upgrade a desktop computer to support the DVI-D interface. Which of the following PC expansion cards would the technician upgrade?

4 A user is on a business trip with a company issued Windows 7 laptop and is unable to connect to corporate WLAN. To temporarily reconfigure the settings, which of the following must the technician must access?

choices.A: Start/Control Panel/Network and Sharing Center/Change Adapter Settings/Wireless Network Connection Properties

choices.B: Start/Control Panel/Network and Sharing Center/Manage Wireless Networks/Profile Types

choices.C: Start/Control Panel/Network and Sharing Center/Manage Wireless Networks/Add/Create an ad hoc network

choices.D: Start/Control Panel/Network and Sharing Center/Manage Wireless Networks/Add/Manually create a network profile

d.q: 5 A smartphone user experiences difficulty removing the back cover of the device. Once finally removed, the battery appears to have swollen. The battery is still functional, but requires more frequent charging than it used to. Which of the following should the user do NEXT?

choices.A: Remove the battery and let it cool for 24 hours

choices.B: Fully discharge and then fully recharge the battery

choices.C: Short the battery terminals with a paper clip

choices.D: Replace the battery with a new one

d.q: 6 Which of the following BIOS level settings allow an administrator to view warnings on possible hardware level changes?

7 A technician just installed an antivirus suite on a workstation. It is kept up-to-date and has recently scanned the system. A day later the user reports slower response times than usual. Which of the following is the user MOST likely experiencing?

8 A technician installs a new video card in a desktop with onboard video. The technician boots the unit but sees no display. The monitor power light is on and the OS seems to be loading. Which of the following is the MOST likely cause?

choices.B: The video card needs to be flashed.

choices.C: The internal adapter has not been disabled.

choices.D: The new video card is defective.

d.q: 9 A user is having problems printing. The technician believes the printer may be out of ink. Which of the following troubleshooting steps should be performed NEXT?

choices.A: Establish a plan of action to resolve the problem

choices.C: Test the theory to determine cause

d.q: 0 The contrast ratio for an LCD monitor is BEST defined as the ratio between:

choices.C: power savings of a comparable CRT monitor and the LCD.

choices.D: the darkest and lightest displayed output.

d.q: 1 A technician arrives in Germany and discovers that when their PC is plugged into the outlet, no power is received. Which of the following actions should the technician take to get the PC to operate?

choices.A: Change the BIOS settings to the local time

choices.C: Attach a 220-volt power strip from the current region to the PC

choices.D: Attach a 120-volt battery backup power supply to the PC

d.q: 2 Which of the following technologies is the MOST secure form of wireless encryption?

8 Which of the following has color codes that match on both ends (e.g. orange-white, orange, green- white, blue, blue-white, green, brown-white, brown)?

0 Which of the following would likely be the MOST cost-effective media to use for storing 8GB of data?
1 A network administrator has a requirement to implement a WiFi hot-spot for the public. Which of the following should be used for secure access?
2 An IT Director wants to increase security on the company website to prevent man-in-the-middle attacks. Which of the following Internet protocols should be implemented to meet the requirement?

3 An office printer that was working earlier in the day is no longer printing any documents. Pre- existing workstations are manually configured to print to the printer directly over the network. A technician has started to troubleshoot the problem and determines that the printer can still be seen in the network directory. The technician has also verified that the printer can print self - diagnostic pages successfully.Which of the following is the MOST likely cause of the problem?

choices.A: The printer's IP address has changed.

choices.B: The network print spooler service has been restarted.

choices.C: "Perform Printer Maintenance" message is displayed on the printer's LCD panel.

choices.D: Two or more users sent print jobs simultaneously, causing a print collision.

d.q: 0 Which of the following devices is used to convert initially audible signals into digital signals to provide communication between two endpoints?
1 A user has lost connection to the Internet, but can still browse locally shared folders. Which of the following connections is MOST likely down?

3 Which of the following devices requires 3.3V of power from the motherboard?
4 Multicast addresses fall in which of the following classful address ranges?
5 Which of the following translates digital signals into analog for transmission over phone lines?

7 Which of the following cable types should always be used through life safety areas?
8 Which of the following 802.11 standards has a MAXIMUM bandwidth throughput of 54Mbps and uses 2.4GHz frequency?
9 A user has 6,250 Megabytes worth of pictures they would like to back up. At the very MINIMUM, which of the following could backup these pictures to a single medium?
0 Laser printers and thermal printers both use a heating element to function. Which of the following differentiates them?

choices.A: Laser printers require a liquid pigment.

choices.B: Thermal printers use device specific stock.

choices.C: Laser printers do not require thermal toner.

choices.D: Thermal printers utilize refillable heat toner.

d.q: 1 When referring to laser printing, which of the following describes the development process?

choices.A: The corona wire places a static charge on the drum.

choices.B: Toner is pulled to the charged areas of the drum.

choices.C: Toner is pulled from the drum to the paper.

choices.D: The toner is permanently affixed to the paper.

5 When a technician suspects prohibited activity on an organization's network or computers, which of the following is the FIRST step they should take?

choices.A: Confirm an actual infraction has taken place

choices.B: Confront the suspected person with incident details

choices.C: Notify others so that peers will stop the activity

choices.D: Erase the contents of the user's computer and disable their account

choices.A: Replace the CPU heat sync with a high RPM fan

choices.B: Purchase an energy efficient power supply

d.q: 9 Which of the following wireless standards operates at 5GHz? (Select TWO).

0 A technician is preparing to perform a processor upgrade on a critical company server. Which of the following precautions should be taken FIRST before performing such work on a system? (Select TWO).

choices.A: Discharge all capacitors inside the PSU

choices.C: Ensure the PSU is plugged into a grounded electrical socket

choices.D: Ensure humidity levels within the room are lowered

choices.E: Put on an anti-static wrist strap

d.q: 1 Which of the following devices uses both light and a lens to facilitate data warehousing?

2 Activity logs show a large amount of data downloaded from a company server to an employee's workstation overnight. Upon further investigation, the technician identifies the data as being outside the scope of the employee's regular job functions. Which of the following steps should the technician take NEXT?
3 Which of the following supports a MAXIMUM frequency of 100MHz?

4 A brand new datacenter has been wired with all CAT6a wiring. A technician has been tasked to immediately install and boot up an already configured mission critical file server. Prior to turning the server on, the technician realizes that they had brought CAT5e patch cords by mistake. Which of the following should the technician do ?

choices.A: Install the CAT5e cable, boot the server and then return and replace it later.

choices.B: Inform the customer and recommend temporarily using the CAT5e cable.

choices.C: Install the CAT5e cable, document the installation and leave the premises.

choices.D: Inform the customer that the server will be available as soon as a CAT6a cable is acquired.

A technician has been asked to install a shared network printer in the environment. Which of the following MUST the technician know in order to add the printer to the environment?
7 A technician has been asked to install a printer on a Windows XP machine. Through which of the following Control Panel utilities will the technician install the printer?

8 A technician has been asked to share a laser printer amongst the users in an HR workgroup. The printer will need to be accessed from distances up to 200 feet through no more than one to two, hollow, dry board walls. Which of the following methods should be used ?

9 A technician has been asked to identify the unknown network addresses from a series of printers attached to the network via external hardware printer servers. Which of the following will provide the technician with the necessary information?

choices.A: Performing a device self test print page from each printer

choices.B: Performing a device print page from each print server

choices.C: Performing a device factory reset on each print server

choices.D: Performing a PING of each device address without the FQDN

choices.E: Proper orientation of the data cable

choices.A: Apply a new preventative maintenance kit.

choices.B: Ensure the MFD is connected and on the network.

choices.C: Replace all empty ink cartridges in the MFD.

choices.D: Check the toner level to see if it is low.

03 A service call was opened for a thermal printer that has poor print quality. Which of the following should the technician do FIRST?

choices.A: Replace the print head with OEM replacement.

choices.B: Use a cotton swab and alcohol to clean the print head.

choices.C: Use the printer manufacturer's cleaning kit to clean the print head.

choices.D: Use an industry approved cleaning kit to clean the print rollers.

choices.E: Use the printer manufacturer's cleaning kit to clean the print rollers.

choices.A: Install a manufacturer recommended maintenance kit

choices.B: Install the fuser, replace the toner cartridge, and replace the pickup and separation rollers

choices.C: Install the fuser and also replace the high voltage power supply

choices.D: Install the fuser as the paper jams were probably also caused by the defective fuser

choices.B: Use ipconfig to check the current settings and Network Connections to make changes

choices.C: Assign the NIC an APIPA address using ipconfig and the network setup wizard

choices.D: Reboot the computer and configure the necessary network settings in the BIOS

56 A technician has a work order to install a USB 3.0 expansion card into a PC. The expansion card is a PCI Express 1.1 compliant card and the motherboard has one PCI Express 2.0 slot available. Which of following BEST represents the compatibility between the hardware?

choices.A: It will not install correctly, and the PCI slot is already being used by the video card.

choices.B: It will install correctly to the PCI Express slot onto the motherboard. The card should function correctly, as the PCI Express 2.0 slot is backwards compliant.

choices.C: It will not install correctly into the PC, as the 1.1 and 2.0 slots are not compatible.

choices.D: It will install correctly, but the card will not operate as the PCI Express 1.1 and the PCI Express 2.0 standards are completely different.

choices.A: The antivirus software is blocking the incoming connection.

choices.B: The ISP is blocking Remote Desktop at their end.

choices.C: The RDP connection has been configured to use a non-standard port.

choices.D: The telnet service has not been installed.

choices.B: Additional power to PCIx peripheral cards

choices.C: Additional power to the South Bridge

choices.D: Additional power to the CPU voltage regulator

d.q: 81 Jot, a user, has installed a new monitor on an existing system. Jot calls a support technician and reports that everything on the new display is fuzzy. Which of the following describes what needs to be changed to correct this issue?

choices.A: The display resolution needs to match the native resolution.

choices.B: The old graphics card does not support the new monitor.

choices.C: The new monitor cable needs to have aluminum cores installed.

choices.D: The new monitor requires updated drivers to be installed.

d.q: 82 Ann, a user, has recently installed a new Blu-Ray ROM in her desktop computer. The computer recognizes the device as a DVD-ROM. Which of the following actions would enable the system to recognize the device as a Blu-Ray device?

choices.A: The operating system must be upgraded to Windows Ultimate.

choices.C: Upgrade to the latest Windows Media Player.

choices.D: Install the manufacture’s drivers for the OS.

d.q: 83 Which of the following external ports would a technician use to connect a keyboard? (Select TWO).
84 A technician has 2GB of data that needs to be backed up from a customer’s Windows 7 computer. Which of the following storage media should the technician use?
85 Which of the following adapter types uses a 7-pin cable to transmit video signals?
